line: Excuse me, Agent Mulder. She’s being transferred now.

speaker: MULDER
line: There’s absolutely no point to you doing this, Marty. We’re going to find him with or without your help.

speaker: MARTY
line: I’m sorry.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi, Marty.

speaker: MARTY
line: What’s going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: Detective Pennock is with the warden right now arranging for your release.

speaker: MARTY
line: Ah! What?

speaker: MULDER
line: The charges against you are being dropped. You’re no longer a suspect in this case.

speaker: MARTY
line: How can they do that?! I confessed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, well, confession is worthless if it’s a lie, and yours was a lie.

speaker: MARTY
line: What have you been telling them?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just that you’re innocent, which is something they would have found out on their own anyway. The locker you sent us to? It had prints on it, but they weren’t yours.

speaker: MARTY
line: I was careful.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, well, somebody else wasn’t so careful. Charles Wesley Gotts, an ex-con. Convicted in 1970 of aggravated assault. He was paroled three weeks ago and he’s been missing ever since.

speaker: MARTY
line: Never heard of him.

speaker: MULDER
line: I happen to believe that, Marty. The PCR tests confirmed that it was his blood on the glove. The tests confirmed something else, Marty. He’s your father. That was the connection.

speaker: MARTY
line: Hmm.

speaker: PENNOCK
line: Okay, we’re all set. That is, if everything’s taken care of on this end.

speaker: MARTY
line: What’s he talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: Detective Pennock has agreed to not pursue aiding and abetting charges if you agree to help us... if you agree to help us find him. We need your help, Marty. You can end it now.

speaker: MARTY
line: I can end this.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m sure that’s what you’ve always wanted.

speaker: MARTY
line: I never wanted to spend my life in a place like this. I had no choice. Hmm. If I help you, will you protect me until he’s caught?

speaker: PENNOCK
line: I will personally guarantee your safety.

speaker: MARTY
line: Hmmm. Take me home.

speaker: VOICE ON POLICE RADIO
line: Moving into position at the back exit.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, stand by.

speaker: VOICE ON POLICE RADIO
line: Copy that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just in time for the surprise party.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She told you he’d be in there?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, she described this place perfectly, right down to the matchbooks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What made her decide to cooperate? MULDER; She wants to stop him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All of a sudden? I mean, if she’s so anxious to stop him, why didn’t she tell us his name before now?

speaker: MULDER
line: She didn’t know his name. They’ve never met. He’s been in prison her entire life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, yet, according to you, she’s been seeing through his eyes the whole time.

speaker: MULDER
line: I - I don’t think she was sure exactly what she was seeing but it was more like a - a constant image in her mind that she learned to live with over time. Up until three weeks ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When the murders started.

speaker: MULDER
line: He was paroled and everything changed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if all this is true, let's go get him. Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Everything’s changed for her, Scully. I don’t think we’re going to find him in there.

speaker: PENNOCK
line: Need some help over there?

speaker: MARTY
line: Nope.

speaker: PENNOCK
line: Should’ve known. Now you know, you don’t have to pack everything you own. I promise you, you’re not going to be in protective custody that long.

speaker: MARTY
line: It’s too late for that, anyway.

speaker: PENNOCK
line: Why is that?

speaker: MARTY
line: Gotts is already here.

speaker: PENNOCK
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MARTY
line: He’s been keeping tabs on me for about a day. Now he knows where I live. He’s reading the names on the mailboxes right now.

speaker: PENNOCK
line: What? How could you know........

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you know he wouldn’t be in there?

speaker: MULDER
line: She doesn’t want us to get him. She misdirected us on purpose.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She’s still protecting him?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, she’s not. She never was. Pennock’s not picking up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s not him she’s been protecting. If he goes back to prison, so does she. Until now, she’s never had a choice.

speaker: MARTY
line: I hate the way you see me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: PENNOCK
line: She did this one. Trust me.

speaker: MARTY
line: Not much to look at, is it? At least, that’s what they tell me. You were at the sentencing, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it my cologne?

speaker: MARTY
line: No, I just knew you’d be there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Marty, let me speak to the judge on your behalf.

speaker: MARTY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: We found where he’d been staying. It was a motel not far from where Paco Ordonez had been murdered.

speaker: MARTY
line: And before that, Atlantic City. Hmmm. I’d never seen the ocean before. And now when I close my eyes, or even when I open them, that’s all I see.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, you’re lucky he wasn’t a fan of the Ice Capades.

speaker: GUARD OVER INTERCOM
line: Lights out.
